title: Calories in a Saltine Cracker
meta_description: Discover calories in a saltine cracker, including carbs, sodium, fat, protein, and quick variations for better snacking choices.
assumptions: Standard plain saltine cracker (~2 g each), no toppings or added flavors.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, and ingredients; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A single saltine cracker contains about 13 kcal and is low in fat but high in sodium.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a saltine cracker?
faqs.a: Approximately 13 kcal per standard saltine cracker.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in one saltine cracker?
faqs.a: About 135 mg of sodium per cracker.
They have 2 g carbs per cracker, making them relatively low carb.

faqs.q: How does brand affect calories in saltines?
faqs.a: Brands vary slightly; some may have 12-15 kcal per cracker due to recipe differences.

faqs.q: Can I eat saltines on a low-fat diet?
faqs.a: Yes, with only 0.3 g fat per cracker, they fit well in low-fat plans.
